article.title: Cary_Elwes

template.arg: Elwes at the [[2015 Toronto International Film Festival]].

article.paragraph: Cary Elwes(IPAc-enˈɛlwɪs; born 26 October 1962),cite newshttp://www.upi.com/Odd_News/2008/10/26/The_almanac/UPI-34121225006200The AlmanacUPI26 October 200829 July 2012cite journalWorld Almanac[[Kent County Daily Times]]26 October 2010Today's Birthdays: Cary Elwesis anEnglandEnglishactor,screenwriter,cite webhttp://www.thewrap.com/colin-hanks-johnny-knoxville-alex-pettyfer-added-to-elvis-nixon/Colin Hanks, Johnny Knoxville, Alex Pettyfer Added to 'Elvis & Nixon'TheWrapproducer andThe New York Times Best Seller listbest-sellingauthorBest Sellers - The New York Timesknown for his roles inThe Princess Bride (film)The Princess Bride;Glory (1989 film)Glory;Robin Hood: Men in Tights;Days of Thunder;Bram Stoker's Dracula;Hot Shots!;Twister (1996 film)Twister;Liar, Liar; and as Dr.Lawrence Gordon (Saw)Lawrence GordoninSaw (2004 film)Saw.cite webhttp://www.boxofficemojo.com/people/chart/?idCary Elwes Movie Box Office Results[[Box Office Mojo]]27 September 2011He has also hadRecurring characterrecurring rolesin television series such asThe X-Files(portrayingBrad Follmer) andPsych(portrayingPierre Despereaux).
article.heading: Early life
article.paragraph: Elwes was bornIvan Simon Cary ElwesinWestminster,London. He is the youngest of three boys born to portrait-painterDominic Elwescite journalhttp://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20105004,00.htmlA Hero to the HiltCerioGregory43[[People (American magazine)|People]]6 February 199526 September 2011http://www.webcitation.org/61z6f7VsK26 September 2011no5and interior designer and socialiteTessa Kennedy. His brothers areDamian Elwes, an artist,andCassian Elwes, an independentfilm producer. He was the stepson ofElliott Kastner, an American film producer.Elwes' paternal grandfather was painterSimon Elwes,cite journalhttp://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P2-3979412.htmlJae-HaKimBritish actor takes turn as American in 'Glory'25[[Chicago Sun-Times]]12 January 1990whose father was the diplomat and tenorGervase Elwes(18661921).cite bookLoose Canon: A Portrait of Brian Brindleyhttp://books.google.com/?idThompsonDamianDamian Thompson134[[Continuum International Publishing Group|Continuum]]0-8264-7418-722 June 2004His other great-grandfathers were diplomatRennell Rodd, 1st Baron Rennell, Sir John Macfarlane Kennedy, and Croatian industrialistIvan Rikard Ivanovi. Elwes' ancestry is English, Irish, Scottish, Croatian Jewish (later Catholic converts), and Serbian (the latter two through his maternal grandmother,Daka McLean, born Daka Marija Ivanovi-Banac; her brother, Elwes' great-uncle, was diplomatVane Ivanovi). One of Elwes' ancestors isJohn Elwes (politician)John Elwes, who is alleged in some sources to have been the inspiration forEbenezer ScroogeinA Christmas Carol(1843)cite webhttp://thecia.com.au/reviews/c/images/christmas-carol-production-notes.doc''Disney's A Christmas Carol'' Production Notes6152KB [[DOC (computing)|.DOC]] file; [http://web.archive.org/web/20091009171220/http://thecia.com.au/reviews/c/images/christmas-carol-production-notes.doc HTML version]Cinematic Intelligence Agency21 October 2009http://www.webcitation.org/5tLrhTKfT9 October 2010no(Elwes played five roles in theA Christmas Carol (2009 film)2009 film adaptationof the novel).Through his maternal grandfather, he is also related toAlexander Kennedyone of the first photographers to document the archaeological site ofPetrainJordanfollowing the collapse of theOttoman Empire.

He was brought up as aRoman Catholicand was analtar boyatWestminster Cathedral, although he did not attenddenominationalschools, unlike most of the men on his father's side of the family, including his ownfather.cite webGuthrieMarisahttp://www.nydailynews.com/archives/entertainment/2005/12/04/2005-12-04_the_spirit_moved_him.htmlThe spirit moved him[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]]Elwes, who grew up a Catholic...4 December 200513 September 2010http://www.webcitation.org/61zzNYuVF26 September 2011noHis paternal forbears include suchclericsasDudley Charles Cary-Elwes(18681932), theRoman CatholicRoman Catholic Diocese of NorthamptonBishop of Northampton(192132), as well as AbbottColumba Cary-Elwes(Ampleforth Abbey,Saint Louis Abbey), and Father Luke Cary-Elwes (Fort Augustus Abbey). He discussed some of this background in an interview while he was filming the 2005CBStelevision film,Pope John Paul II (miniseries)Pope John Paul II, in which Elwes played the young priestKarol Wojtya.

When he was four-years-old his parents divorced and in1975, when Elwes was thirteen, his father committed suicide. For his education Elwes attendedHarrow Schooland then theLondon Academy of Music and Dramatic Art.cite journalDr Gordon is back in Saw – Cary Elwes's character from the first Saw film is back by popular demand[[The Straits Times]]5 January 2011In 1981, he moved to the United States to study acting atSarah Lawrence CollegeinBronxville, New York.cite journalThe 'Robin' Who Has Sherwood Forest ChucklingTam JrHenry[[San Francisco Chronicle]]C613 August 1993While living there, Elwes studied acting at both theActors Studioand theLee Strasberg Theatre and Film Instituteunder the tutelage ofAl Pacino's mentor, Charlie Laughton (not to be confused with the British actor Charles Laughton).As a teenager he also worked as aproduction assistanton the filmsAbsolution (1978 film)Absolution,OctopussyandSuperman (1978 film)Superman, where he was assigned toMarlon Brando. When Elwes introduced himself to the famous actor, Brando told him that his (Elwes') name was actually "Rocky" afterRocky Marciano.cite webhttp://www.youtube.com/watch?vMark & Brian w/Cary Elwes on Marlon BrandoYouTube8 May 200823 June 2013
article.heading: Career
Film
article.paragraph: Elwes made his acting:wikt:debutdebutin 1984 withMarek Kanievska's filmAnother Country (film)Another Countryloosely based on the Englishboarding schoolexploits of British spiesGuy BurgessBurgess,Donald Maclean (spy)MacLeanandKim PhilbyPhilby. He played James Harcourt, a young and sentimental homosexual student.He went on to playGuilford Dudleyin the British filmLady Jane (film)Lady Jane, oppositeHelena Bonham Carter. He was then cast as a stable boy turned swashbuckler Westley inRob Reiner's fantasy-comedyThe Princess Bride (film)The Princess Bride, based on theThe Princess Bridenovel of the same namebyWilliam Goldman. It was a modestbox officesuccess,cite journal'The Princess Bride' Turns 20[[The Palm Beach Post]]6JGray StreeterLeslie9 December 2007[w]as a modest hit. But it became a raging cult classic after being released on video and shown on cable.but received critical acclaim, earning a score of 96% on the review aggregation websiteRotten Tomatoes.cite webhttp://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/princess_bridePrince Bride (1987)[[Rotten Tomatoes]]November 3, 2014Since being released on home video and television it has become acult filmcult classic.In an interview around the film'sDVDrelease in 2001, Elwes said, "The studio didn't know how to market it... Was it an adventure? A fantasy? A comedy? A romance? A kid's movie? In the end they sold it as a kid's movie and it largely had to rely on word of mouth". He also acknowledged the film's cult following saying, "People tell me they still have theirVHScopy that has been passed down from one generation to the next".cite journal'Bride' basks in glow of video[[Houston Chronicle]]WestbrookBruce6 September 2001

He continued working steadily, varying between dramatic roles, as in theAcademy Award-winningGlory (1989 film)Glory(1989), and comedic roles, as inHot Shots!(1991). In 1993, he starred asRobin HoodinMel Brooks's comedy,Robin Hood: Men in Tights. Elwes also appeared in such films asFrancis Coppola's adaptation ofDracula (1992 film)Bram Stoker's Dracula,The Crush (1993 film)The Crush,The Jungle Book (1994 film)The Jungle Book(1994),Twister (1996 film)Twister,Liar Liar, andKiss the Girls (film)Kiss the Girls. In 1999, he portrayed famed theatre and film producerJohn HousemanforTim Robbinsin his ensemble film based onOrson Welles's musical,Cradle Will Rock. And months after that he traveled toLuxembourgto work withJohn MalkovichandWillem Dafoein theAcademy AwardNominatedShadow of the Vampire. In 2001, he co-starred inPeter Bogdanovich's ensemble filmThe Cat's Meowportraying movie mogulThomas H. InceThomas Incewho died mysteriously while vacationing withWilliam Randolph Hearston hisyacht.

In 2004, he starred in theHorror filmhorrorThriller (genre)thrillerSaw (2004 film)Sawwhich, at a budget of a little over $1 million, grossed over $100 million worldwide.cite webhttp://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?idSaw (2004)[[Box Office Mojo]]16 August 2011The same year he appeared inElla Enchanted (film)Ella Enchanted, this time as the villain not the hero. He made an uncredited appearance asSamuel Adams GreenSam Green, the man who introducedAndy WarholtoEdie Sedgwick, in the 2006 filmFactory Girl (film)Factory Girl. In 2007, he appeared inGarry Marshall'sGeorgia RuleoppositeJane Fonda.

In 2010, Elwes returned to theSawfranchise inSaw 3D(2010), the seventh and final film in the series, as Dr.Lawrence Gordon (character)Lawrence Gordon.cite webhttp://www.bloody-disgusting.com/news/19954/Cary Elwes Confirmed for 'Saw 3D', Full Synopsis and CastBloody Disgusting25 April 201025 April 201025 April 2010http://www.webcitation.org/5pFMaRGrLnoIn 2011, he was selected byIvan Reitmanto star alongsideNatalie PortmaninNo Strings Attached (film)No Strings Attached. That same year, Elwes andGarry Marshallteamed up again in the romantic comedyNew Years Eve.

In 2012, Elwes starred in the independent dramaThe Citizen (film)The Citizen.cite webhttp://www.variety.com/article/VR11180398484 thesps apply for 'The Citizen'SneiderJeffVariety13 July 201126 September 2011http://www.webcitation.org/620GcKyyS26 September 2011noIn 2013 Elwes joinedSelena Gomezfor the comedy ensemble,Behaving Badly (film)Behaving Badlydirected by Tim Garrick. This year he has completed four movies:John Herzfeld's comedyReach MeoppositeSylvester Stallone; the ensemble drama,Sugar Mountain (film)Sugar Mountaindirected by Richard Gray; and the dramasH8RZ, directed by Derrick Borte,The Greens Are Gone, oppositeCatherine Keenerdirected by Peer Pedersen andIndiscretion, oppositeMira Sorvinodirected by John Stewart Muller.

On 13 December 2012,The Hollywood Reporterannounced that Elwes would be making his directorial debut in an independent film about the life ofKit Lambert, manager of the iconic rock groupThe Who, working with a script by Pat Gilbert, an editor of the British music magazineMojo (magazine)Mojo.Cary Elwes to direct biopic about Kit Lambert, hollywoodreporter.com; accessed 4 March 2014.The film is based on interviews and recordings with Lambert made by journalist Jon Lindsay, and is being produced by Orian Williams.
In October of 2013 Elwes filmed the thrillerCawdorat The Barn Theatre in Augusta Michigan.

In 2014, it was announced thatKevin SpaceyandMichael Shannonhad signed on to portrayRichard NixonandElvis Presleyrespectively in a feature film entitledElvis & Nixon, written by Elwes withHanala Sagaland Joey Sagal, about the pair's famous meeting at theWhite Housein1970.

link.part: Elwes hostsUSA Network's "Psych" panel at the 2013San Diego Comic ConInternational, inSan Diego

article.heading: Television
article.paragraph: Elwes made his firsttelevisionappearance in 1996 as David Lookner onSeinfeld. Two years later he playedastronautMichael Collins (astronaut)Michael Collinsin theGolden Globe Award-winningHBOminiseriesFrom the Earth to the Moon (miniseries)From the Earth To the Moon. The following year Elwes was nominated for aGolden Satellite Awardfor Best Performance by an Actor in a Mini-Series or Motion Picture Made for Television for his portrayal of ColonelJames G. BurtonJames BurtoninThe Pentagon Warsdirected byRichard Benjamin. In 1999, he guest starred as Dr. John York in an episode of the television seriesThe Outer Limits (1995 TV series)The Outer Limits. Shortly afterward he received anotherGolden Satellite Awardnomination for his work on the ensemble NBC Television movieUprising (2001 film)UprisingoppositeJon Voightdirected byJon Avnet. Elwes had a recurring role in the final season (from 2001 to 2002) ofChris Carter (screenwriter)Chris Carter's hit mini-seriesThe X-FilesasFBI Assistant DirectorBrad Follmer.

In 2004, he portrayedserial killerTed Bundyin theA&E (TV channel)A&E NetworkfilmThe Riverman, which became one of the highest rated original movies in the networks history and garnered a prestigiousBanff World Media FestivalBANFF Rockie Awardnomination. The following year, Elwes played the youngPope John Paul IIin theCBStelevision filmPope John Paul II (miniseries)Pope John Paul II, his second time working withJon Voight. The TV film was highly successful not only inNorth America, but also inEurope, where it broke box office records in the late pope's nativePolandand became the first film ever to break $1 million (GBP588,200) in three days.cite newsPope Picture Breaks Box Office Recordshttp://www.contactmusic.com/new/xmlfeed.nsf/mndwebpages/pope%20picture%20breaks%20box%20office%20records%20in%20poland_09_03_2006contactmusic.com3 September 2006

In 2007, he made a guest appearance on theLaw & Order: Special Victims Unitepisode "Law & Order: Special Victims Unit (season 8)#ep14Dependent" as aMafialawyer. In 2009, he played the role ofPierre Despereaux, an international art thief, in the fourth season premiere ofPsych.cite webhttp://www.dreadcentral.com/news/35164/first-two-teaser-clips-psych-9First Two Teaser Clips Psych: 9DreadCentral[[CraveOnline]]2 January 201026 September 2011http://www.webcitation.org/620BPhle926 September 2011noIn 2010, he returned toPsych, reprising his role in the second half of thePsych (season 5)fifth season, again in the show'sPsych (season 6)sixth season, and again in the show'sPsych (season 8)eighth seasonpremiere.cite webhttp://www.tvline.com/2011/07/psych-spoiler-video-season-6-james-roday-dule-hillPsych First Look: The Season 6 Scene Everyone Will Be Talking About! Plus, Musical Update!SlezakMichaelTVLine21 July 201127 September 2011http://www.webcitation.org/620HTJJfL27 September 2011noIn 2014, Elwes played Hugh Ashmeade, Director of theCIA, in the second season of the BYUtv series,Granite Flats.
article.heading: Voiceovers
article.paragraph: Elwes'voice-overwork includes thenarratorinJames Patterson'saudiobookThe Jester (novel)The Jester,cite bookThe JesterPatersonJamesJames PattersonGrossAndrewAndrew Gross1-58621-535-3[[Hachette Audio]]Abridged1 March 2003as well as characters in film andtelevision animationssuch asQuest for Camelot,Pinky and The Brain,Batman Beyond, and the English versions of theStudio Ghiblifilms,Porco Rosso,Whisper of the Heart (film)Whisper of the HeartandThe Cat Returns. For the 2004 video gameThe Bard's Tale (2004)The Bard's Tale, he served asscreenwriter, improviser, andvoice actingvoice actorof the main character The Bard. In 2009, Elwes re-united withJason Alexanderfor theIndian film,Delhi Safari.cite webhttp://www.bollywoodhungama.com/news/2011/05/30/15833/index.htmlDelhi Safari to feature voice over by Vanessa Williams and Jason Alexander[[Bollywood Hungama]]30 May 201126 September 2011http://www.webcitation.org/620CPeGXA26 September 2011noThe following year Elwes portrayed the part of Gremlin Gus in Disney's video game,Epic Mickey 2: The Power of Two. Over the last couple years, Elwes came in to play the voice of Aquaman in the DC Straight to DVD animated filmJustice League: The Flashpoint ParadoxJustice League: Flashpoint Paradox, and appeared most recently in an episode ofCosmos: A Spacetime Odysseyas the voice of scientistEdmond Halley, in the episodeWhen Knowledge Conquered Fearin 2014.
article.heading: Mo-Cap
article.paragraph: In 2009, Elwes joined the cast ofRobert Zemeckissmotion captureadaptation ofCharles Dickens'A Christmas Carol (2009 film)A Christmas Carolportraying five roles. That same year he was chosen bySteven Spielbergto appear in hismotion captureadaptation ofBelgiumBelgianartistHerg's popular comic stripThe Adventures of Tintin: The Secret of the Unicorn.cite webhttp://www.digitalspy.com/movies/news/a347079/the-adventures-of-tintin-premieres-in-london-pictures.html#~p5ZywC1hHstyq3'The Adventures Of Tintin' premieres in London - PicturesDigital Spy
article.heading: Theatre
article.paragraph: In 2003, Elwes portrayedKerry Max Cookin theoff-BroadwayplayThe Exonerated (play)The ExoneratedinNew York, directed byBob Balaban(1823 March 2003).cite webhttp://www.playbill.com/news/article/78481-Cary-Elwes-and-Brooke-Shields-Join-Off-Broadways-Exonerated-March-18-23Cary Elwes and Brooke Shields Join Off-Broadway's ''Exonerated'', 18-23 MarchHernandezErnioPlaybill.com18 March 200327 September 2011http://www.webcitation.org/620HfyaXS27 September 2011no
article.heading: Literature
article.paragraph: In October 2014, Touchstone (Simon & Schuster) published Elwes'memoirof the making ofThe Princess Bride, entitledAs You Wish: Inconceivable Tales from the Making of The Princess Bride, which Elwes co-wrote with Joe Layden. The book is filled with never-before-told stories, exclusive photographs, and interviews with costarsRobin Wright,Wallace Shawn,Billy Crystal,Christopher Guest,Fred SavageandMandy Patinkin, as well as author and screenwriterWilliam Goldman, producerNorman Lear, and directorRob Reiner. The book debuted onThe New York Times Best Seller list.''As You Wish: Inconceivable Tales from the Making of The Princess Bride'', nytimes.com, 2 November 2014; accessed 18 November 2014.'Cary Elwes wrote book about the making of the film, ''The Princess Bride'', geekwithcurves.com, June 2014; accessed 18 November 2014.
article.heading: Personal life
article.paragraph: Elwes metunit still photographerstills photographerLisa Marie Kurbikoff in 1991 at aMalibu, Baja CaliforniaMalibuCook-off#Chili cook-offchili cook-offand became engaged in 1997.cite journalCelebrities{{spaced ndash}}DeGeneres 'Bedding' Talk-Show Guests[[Watertown Daily Times]]3 May 2007D2Elwes and Lisa Marie (née Kurbikoff) met in 1991 at a Malibu chili cook-off. They were engaged in 1997 and tied the knot three years later.They married in 2000 and have one child.cite webhttp://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20037158,00.htmlCary Elwes, Wife Welcome a GirlSilvermanStephen M.JordanJuliePeople27 April 200726 September 2011http://www.webcitation.org/61zBZ2eeX26 September 2011no

In August 2005, Elwes filed a lawsuit againstEvolution Entertainment, his management firm and producer ofSaw (2004 film)Saw. Elwes said he was promised a minimum of one percent of the producers' net profits of the film and did not receive the full amount.cite newsNot everyone happy with their cut from Sawhttp://www.theage.com.au/news/film/not-everyone-happy-with-their-cut-from-saw/2005/08/20/1124435169494.htmlMitchellPeter[[Association of American Publishers|AAP]][[The Age]]20 August 200526 September 2011http://www.webcitation.org/61z597QPB26 September 2011noThe case eventually waslegal settlementsettled out of court. In 2010, he reprised his role inSaw 3D.cite webhttp://www.fangoria.com/index.php?id"Saw VII" Synopsis and Cast Revealed{{spaced ndash}}Including Cary Elwes!GingoldMichael[[Fangoria]]25 April 201026 September 2011http://www.webcitation.org/61z5ZIds026 September 2011no
